comment.author: 45586426@N06
comment._content: Showing its distinctive planform while seen turning away from the camera plane, a great but low definition monochrome shot of highly decorated Douglas F4D-1 Skyray Bu No 139097 of “All Weather Fighter Squadron” VFAW-3. With squadron code PA and ‘Modex’ code 12. ‘Last four’ of serial 9097 on base of rudder. Also seen is the “special electronics package” on the centerline pylon and two 300-gallon auxiliary fuel tanks plus what may be on the outer pylons, two 12-rocket dispensers of 2.75-inch unguided rockets, and fuselage pylons with two AIM-9 Sidewinder air-to-missiles. Based at NAS North Island, San Diego, California. VFAW-3 was attached for a time to the North American Air Defense Command. (NORAD) Picture dated 1958. Another ‘flickr’ pic with F4D-1 139097 included, can be seen here: www.flickr.com/photos/my_public_domain_photos/4629797004/ Other low definition ‘flickr’ pictures of F4D-1 139097 may also be seen here: www.flickr.com/photos/sdasmarchives/4559849510/ www.flickr.com/photos/sdasmarchives/4559218451/ www.flickr.com/photos/sdasmarchives/4559218755/ www.flickr.com/photos/sdasmarchives/4559218563/
